problem.p: Two balls, A and B, with masses mA and mB are connected by a taut, massless string, and are moving along a horizontal frictionless plane. The plane is parallel to the screen and gravity points into the screen. The distance between the centers of the two balls is L. At a certain instant, the velocity of ball B has magnitude V and is directed perpendicular to the string and parallel to the horizontal plane, and the velocity of ball A is zero.
The goal is to find the force of tension in terms of mA, mB, V and L.
Hint: before you start solving the problem describe the motion of the balls.
Type mA for mA, mB for mB.
